Articles.Content:
I'd like to ask anyone posting to either use a small amount of text to comment on stations, or add an image depicting your space station with a description of what makes yours easy and useful for a player to use without spending much time on it. Craft files optional.

This is the primary station style I use:

It has 4 docking ports of each size, so easy docking and the placement works with most spacecraft. The fuel tanks sticking out to the sides are docked separately. I have tanks of all sizes because I like to fill some tanks partway to balance the fuel if anything doesn't get filled all the way. Lastly, the station has lots of RCS and Xenon fuel, and stores plenty of electricity which it generates rapidly with those XL photovoltaic panels.

What I like most about this station: It has a low part count compared to what it can do. My meager computer can run this station along with a ship or two docked to it.

Craft file: https://www.dropbox.com/s/bckb8eo7lgsxjn6/SS%20Core%20S_M_L%201_0.craft

This is the base station. You can fly up extra fuel tanks at your leisure. The tanks you see on the sides of mine are very easy to dock.

Edited December 14, 2013 by thereaverofdarkness

I present : The Space Station - Experimental II or SS-E II.

I built this station just because it was cool and who doesn't want to build a cool station in KSP? Originally, the core module (with the Gigantor panels) was supposed to be an attempt at recreating Skylab, but then I added my mini-Salyut-like-thing already in orbit and a sciencey module just to make it look like it has a purpose (it's in sandbox btw).

Fits two Kerbals snugly, but the part count is quite high compared to it's size(too many unoptimized bits and bobs were added for aesthetics only). Still prety proud of it though.

The Gemini is from the excellent FASA Gemini and Mercury pack. The rest of the station is stock, with the exception of a couple Kerbal Engineer chips.
